tool.name: Remove sequencing adaptors
tool.command:
cutadapt -f $format -a $three_prime -b $any_prime -g $five_prime $finput #if $param.psetting.plist == "sfull": -e $psetting.error_rate -n $psetting.count -O $overlaplen #if $param.psetting.wildcards == "yes": --match-read-wildcards #end if #end if
#if $filtering_setting.flist == "f_all": #if $filtering_setting.dscard_trim == "dtrim": --discard-trimmed #end if #if $filtering_setting.dscard_trim == "duntrim": --discard-untrimmed #end if
-m $discard_short
#end if -o $foutput

param.name: any_prime
param.label: Other adaptor
param.help: If you are not sure where your adaptor located, paste above

param.name: count
param.label: Only remove adapters at MOST count N times
param.help: This is helpful to remove adapters appearing multiple times

param.name: overlaplen
param.label: Minimum overlap length
param.help: Read is not modified if the overlap between adapter and read is shorter than N

param.name: wildcards
param.label: Allow 'N's in the read as matches to the adapter

param.name: discard_trim
param.label: Which reads to discard
param.help: Discard reads containing adapters rather than trimmed

param.name: discard_short
param.label: Discard short reads
param.help: Discard trimmed reads that are shorter than N, Reads originally shorter than N will also be discarded

tool.help: This tool is used to remove the adaptor or primer sequences that may be present as a result of library preparation.
